title: 114_hr2996
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk about wildfires on federal lands. Section 102(2) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to define "major disaster" and "major disaster for wildfire on federal lands" as any wildfire on Federal lands warranting assistance to supplement efforts and resources of the Department of the Interior or the Department of Agriculture. The definition of "major disaster for wildfire on federal lands" includes wildfires on Federal lands or on non-Federal lands under specific agreements. The Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to include a new section titled "Major Disaster for Wildfire on Federal Land" with defined terms. The Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to include a new section defining terms related to wildfire management on Federal land, such as Federal land, Federal land management agencies, and wildfire suppression operations. The curr_chunk discusses various aspects of wildland firefighting on Federal lands, including support, response, emergency stabilization activities, and other emergency management activities. This is related to the wildfire suppression subactivity of the Wildland Fire Management account or the FLAME Wildfire Suppression Reserve Fund account of the Federal land management agencies. The curr_chunk discusses the procedure for declaring a major disaster for wildfires on Federal lands. The Secretary of the Interior or Agriculture may request a declaration from the President for a major wildfire disaster on Federal lands. The request must be in writing, certify the appropriated funds for wildfire suppression, and increase the unobligated balance by a specified amount. The Secretary must certify the amount available for wildfire suppression operations and specify the required amount in the current fiscal year. The Secretary certifies the amount available for wildfire suppression operations and specifies the required amount for the current fiscal year. The President may declare a major disaster for wildfires on Federal lands based on the Secretary's request. "Section 803 addresses wildfire assistance on federal lands." In a major disaster for wildfire on Federal lands, the President may transfer funds to the Secretary of the Interior or Agriculture for wildfire suppression operations. A specific account is established for this purpose, limited to the amount requested under a declaration. The assistance available for transfer from the wildfire suppression operations account is limited. Funds can be transferred to the wildfire suppression subactivity of the Wildland Fire Management Account. No other transfers are allowed except as provided in this section. Reimbursement for wildfire suppression operations on non-Federal land is required if funds are used for that purpose. The respective Secretary must secure reimbursement for wildfire suppression operations on non-Federal land and transfer the received amounts to the wildfire suppression operations account. Annual accounting and reporting requirements mandate the submission of a report to specified committees and the public within 90 days after the end of each fiscal year. The Senate requires a report from the Secretary concerned on the risk-based factors influencing wildfire suppression decisions, analysis of large fires for cost drivers and impacts, and total expenditures for wildfire suppression operations. The Senate requires a report from the Secretary concerned on factors influencing wildfire suppression decisions, analysis of large fires for cost drivers, total expenditures, lessons learned, and other relevant matters. This title does not limit the Secretary of the Interior, Secretary of Agriculture, Indian tribe, or State from receiving assistance through a presidential declaration under this Act when criteria are met.
